text: Santite (KB5O8·4H2O) is a hydrated borate mineral of potassium found in Tuscany, Italy. It is named for Georgi Santi (1746–1823), a former director of the Museum of Natural History, Italy. == External links == *Mindat.org - Santite *Webmineral.com - Santite *Handbook of Mineralogy - Santite Category:Potassium minerals Category:Nesoborates Category:Orthorhombic minerals
title: Santite
